page.title: 06BSC WORKINGTON CUMBRIA
page.content: All the products i.e.{rail,fish plates {and sleepers}are set in ranks for examination which if passed allows {stamping and grading}before{stockpiles are constructed.Loading is normally on {rail carriages(120 feet long)}or road if length permits.BSC now employs less than 1000 men,but only five years previously{primary ironmaking}from raw materials to{molten steel production was carried out with{hot ingots}going into{soaking pits.}The ingots were {cogged}down as mentioned with the process being similar to the present. since the closing of the ironworks in 1981 the area of BSC has dramatically declined.The{ironworks and the {Bessamer Sinter plant}have now been scrapped and only large areas of land are left to remind people of what once stood there.
